9.activity: Reviewing emails and setting daily priorities

carousel.text: User reads WSJ in the morning
User scans CNBC for pre‑market trends
User plans day with calendar apps
User sets priorities for the day

suggestions.title: Automate Inbox Triage
suggestions.description: I drafted a rule set that archives newsletters, pins ticker‑related alerts, and auto‑flags leadership mail so your first scan targets decision‑critical messages; activating it will reduce inbox noise by ~35 %.

chats.message: I've created the rules and staged them for review—ready to deploy?
Will VIP messages still come through instantly?
Yes, anything from your VIP list bypasses filters and triggers a Slack ping.

suggestions.title: Two‑Minute Priority Matrix
suggestions.description: Using your overnight email flags and calendar, I generated an Eisenhower matrix and auto‑blocked two 90‑minute focus slots for the urgent‑important quadrant so nothing slips through cracks today.

chats.message: Matrix is live in Notion—want me to push the focus slots to Outlook now?
Push them but mark as tentative.
Done—slots appear as tentative and can be moved if conflicts arise.

suggestions.title: Daily Brief Template
suggestions.description: I built a one‑page morning brief that stitches Bloomberg pre‑market moves, flagged mails, and today’s meetings; the doc auto‑refreshes at 8 : 55 AM and lands in your draft folder for quick sharing.

chats.message: Show me the pre‑market section only.
Here’s the snippet with S&P futures, treasury yields, and FX heatmap—looks good?

suggestions.title: Volatility Spike Alert
suggestions.description: I configured Reuters and CNBC feeds to ping Slack only when any watched index moves ±1 % intraday, ensuring you catch anomalies without constant manual refreshing.

chats.message: Alerts live—threshold set at 1 % with a 15‑minute cool‑down to avoid spam.
Can we add VIX > 18 as a trigger?
Added—VIX breach will fire a high‑priority notification.

suggestions.title: Pomodoro Focus Session
suggestions.description: I prepared a 25‑minute Pomodoro timer with automatic Do‑Not‑Disturb (Bloomberg audio excluded) and scheduled a 5‑minute stretch reminder so you can power through top tasks without interruption.

chats.message: Timer primed—start your first Pomodoro now?
Give me five minutes, then start.
Starting in five; you’ll get a heads‑up ping.

10.activity: Analyzing market data and preparing analytical reports

carousel.text: User uses Tableau for market data
User reviews trading charts on TV
User leverages Excel for trend analysis
User examines stock indices with R
User integrates APIs for data feeds

suggestions.title: Embed FedWatch Probabilities
suggestions.description: I integrated CME FedWatch API into Tableau, refreshing every 15 minutes and caching extracts locally so your dashboard now shows live rate‑hike probability curves with negligible latency.

chats.message: Live FedWatch curves are plotted on the 'Macro' tab—open it?
Open and highlight the next FOMC month.
Highlighted; change propagates to PDF exports automatically.

suggestions.title: Momentum Strategy Back‑Test
suggestions.description: I spun up a Jupyter notebook that back‑tests a 20/80‑day momentum strategy on your equity shortlist, factoring in 5 bps transaction costs and outputting Sharpe ratios and drawdowns.

chats.message: Notebook finished—top‑performer Sharpe 1.42. Share the HTML report?
Yes, email me and save in the research folder.

suggestions.title: Excel Heatmap Enhancement
suggestions.description: I applied conditional formatting across volume, intraday range %, and 14‑day RSI columns, turning extreme values into red or green gradients and inserting a mini‑chart legend for quick interpretation.

chats.message: Heatmap live—want me to freeze columns A‑C for easier scroll?
Freeze them and add filter drop‑downs.

suggestions.title: One‑Page Client Brief
suggestions.description: I drafted a concise PDF summarizing today’s macro shifts, sector‑specific implications, and plain‑language action points for Client A; a glossary sidebar explains any unavoidable jargon.

chats.message: PDF stored in Client‑A/Briefs—ready to send?
Add an ESG note, then send.
ESG note inserted; email scheduled for 11 AM.

suggestions.title: Stress‑Test Scenarios
suggestions.description: I parameterized three macro scenarios (+100 bps rates, oil >$100, USD‑EUR 10 % swing) and ran them through your risk model, exporting VaR and peak‑to‑trough declines for quick review.

chats.message: Scenario results ready in Excel—open now?
Open and plot in a clustered bar chart.
Chart added to the Scenario sheet.

11.activity: Conducting deep analysis on client portfolios and strategies

carousel.text: User writes Python scripts for risk
User uses R for quantitative tests

suggestions.title: Factor Exposure Decomposition
suggestions.description: I executed a five‑factor regression for each client portfolio, generating coefficient charts and flagging any beta drift > 0.25 versus benchmark so hidden tilts are surfaced instantly.

chats.message: Regression output is ready—open the visualization deck?
Open and annotate the drift flags.
Annotations added as callouts in red.

suggestions.title: Monte Carlo Stress Simulation
suggestions.description: I ran 10 000 Monte Carlo paths with Student‑t distributions to capture fat tails, exporting 95 % VaR and expected shortfall tables for each portfolio and benchmark.

chats.message: Simulation complete—want the CSV or interactive dashboard?
Dashboard published to Power BI with drill‑through filters.

suggestions.title: Narrative Performance Summary
suggestions.description: I crafted a 400‑word story‑driven summary translating quantitative results into client‑friendly language, peppered with sparkline charts and pull quotes for quick digestion.

chats.message: Draft ready—review now or after lunch?

suggestions.title: Risk KPI Dashboard Prototype
suggestions.description: I built an interactive Power BI dashboard featuring tracking error, beta drift, and sector concentration alerts, updating hourly with live market feeds.

chats.message: Prototype live—share link with the wider team?

suggestions.title: Tactical Rebalancing Memo
suggestions.description: Based on today’s factor tilt analysis, I drafted a memo recommending a 2 % overweight to quality and 1 % underweight to momentum, including estimated transaction costs.

chats.message: Memo saved—want me to attach to the client portal?
Uploaded and Slack DM sent to the lead.
